article.headline: Brown 80, Quinnipiac 74
article.story: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) -- Mark McAndrew scored 18 points and grabbed 14 rebounds, leading Brown to a 80-74 win over Quinnipiac Saturday night. The Bears (3-5) overcame a five point lead by the Bobcats midway through the second half with a 9-2 run. Brown set a new school record for successful free throws, hitting 47 shots in 60 attempts. Adam Gonzalez paced the Bobcats with 18 points. The Bears were playing without leading scorer Keenan Jepson, who left the team earlier in the day for personal reasons. McAndrew provided Brown with its largest lead of the opening half, 37-28, when he hit a pair of free throws with 2:53 remaining before intermission. Brown led 39-33 at the half. Brown hit on 6-of-15 shots from the field in the first half, but gained an overwhelming edge from the free throw line, making 26-of-33 while the Bobcats converted just 4-of-13. Quinnipiac capped a 17-9 surge at the start of the second half taking its first lead of the game at 50-48 with 12:17 remaining on a pair of free throws from Gonzalez. Brown regained the lead with 7:02 left on a pair of free throws from Chris Skrelja. The 80 points was a season high for the Bears.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
